query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Già era dritta in sù la fiamma e queta 2 per non dir più, e già da noi sen gia 3 con la licenza del dolce poeta,
4 quand’ un’altra, che dietro a lei venìa, 5 ne fece volger li occhi a la sua cima 6 per un confuso suon che fuor n’uscia.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Already she was erect upon the flame and still, 2 to say no more, and already she was departing from us 3 with the permission of the gentle poet,
4 when another, who was coming behind her, 5 made us turn our eyes to her summit 6 because of a confused sound that was coming out of it.
**Cornish:**
1 Ynwedh hi o tfsi ow kul an flam ha skon, 2 rag na leverel moy, ha ow kul hi ow mos 3 gans allos an bardh melyon,
4 pan wosa unn aral, ow tos ow tos, 5 a wrug ni droy an golwg dhe'y benn 6 rag an son kemmysk a veu ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Come ’l bue cicilian che mugghiò prima 8 col pianto di colui, e ciò fu dritto, 9 che l’avea temperato con sua lima,
10 mugghiava con la voce de l’afflitto, 11 sì che, con tutto che fosse di rame, 12 pur el pareva dal dolor trafitto;
13 così, per non aver via né forame 14 dal principio nel foco, in suo linguaggio 15 si convertïan le parole grame.
query.result:
**English:**
7 Like the Sicilian bull that first bellowed 8 with the cries of the one who made it, and rightly so, 9 since he had tempered it with his file,
10 it bellowed with the voice of the afflicted one, 11 so that, even though it was made of bronze, 12 it still seemed pierced by pain;
13 thus, for having no way or opening 14 from the beginning in the fire, in its own language 15 the sorrowful words were transformed.
**Cornish:**
7 Kepar an tarow Sisili a wrug moghya kyns 8 gans an gwelas a'n onan a wrug ev, ha gwir o, 9 a'y tempras gans y lim,
10 ev a wrug moghya gans an lef an onan a veu poenys, 11 kepar, pub tra o o kopor, 12 ev a welas kepar o veu treusys gans an boen;
13 kepar hyn, rag na veu fordh na toll 14 a'n kynsa yn an tan, yn y yeth, 15 an gerow truan a veu treylyes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Ma poscia ch’ebber colto lor vïaggio 17 su per la punta, dandole quel guizzo 18 che dato avea la lingua in lor passaggio,
19 udimmo dire: «O tu a cu’ io drizzo 20 la voce e che parlavi mo lombardo, 21 dicendo “Istra ten va, più non t’adizzo”,
22 perch’ io sia giunto forse alquanto tardo, 23 non t’incresca restare a parlar meco; 24 vedi che non incresce a me, e ardo!
25 Se tu pur mo in questo mondo cieco 26 caduto se’ di quella dolce terra 27 latina ond’ io mia colpa tutta reco,
28 dimmi se Romagnuoli han pace o guerra; 29 ch’io fui d’i monti là intra Orbino 30 e ’l giogo di che Tever si diserra».
query.result:
**English:**
16 But after they had taken their journey 17 up over the peak, giving it the speed 18 that the tongue had given them in their passing,
19 I heard someone say: "O you to whom I address 20 my voice, and who just now spoke Lombard, 21 saying, 'Istra, go on, I won't bother you anymore',
22 even though I may have arrived somewhat late, 23 don't mind staying to talk to me; 24 see that it doesn't bother me, and I'm burning!
25 If you have just now fallen into this blind world 26 from that sweet Latin land 27 from which I derive all my guilt,
28 tell me if the Romagnols have peace or war; 29 for I was from the mountains there between Urbino 30 and the ridge from which the Tiber bursts forth."
**Cornish:**
16 Mes rag oeber cols lor viaj 17 seuf per an ponta, dhandoles an gwits 18 hag dhadho an taves yn lor pasi,
19 ydhwonvos dire: "O ty a ku io dhrijo 20 an lagas ha hag a brevas mo lombard, 21 leverel 'Istra ten va, moy nans t'adhiso',
22 rag io sya junsa fors ankwens tardo, 23 nans t'inkreska restat rag pari me, 24 gweles na nans inkreska dhe'm, ha ardhof!
25 Se ty pur mo yn an bys magh seko 26 kadhys se' dhe an dholls tir lathen 27 latin ond' io va golpa oll rek,
28 dhimma se Romagnolis han peys o ger, 29 rag io va dhe'n mensi ena Urbino 30 ha'n jok dhe hag Tever sy dhiserra."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 Io era in giuso ancora attento e chino, 32 quando il mio duca mi tentò di costa, 33 dicendo: «Parla tu; questi è latino».
query.result:
**English:**
31 I was still attentive and bent down below, 32 when my guide touched me on the side, 33 saying: "Speak to him; this man is Latin."
**Cornish:**
31 Yth o vy dheghowgh ynwedh hager, 32 pan vyn dywgh a'm temptas warbarth, 33 ow leverel: "Kowetha; hemma yw Latin."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 E io, ch’avea già pronta la risposta, 35 sanza indugio a parlare incominciai: 36 «O anima che se’ là giù nascosta,
37 Romagna tua non è, e non fu mai, 38 sanza guerra ne’ cuor de’ suoi tiranni; 39 ma ’n palese nessuna or vi lasciai.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And I, who already had my answer ready, 35 began to speak without delay: 36 "O soul who art hidden down there,
37 Romagna, your land, is not, and never was, 38 without war in the hearts of its tyrants; 39 but I left none of it openly there now.
**Cornish:**
34 Ha my, ow a'm gorra gorra an golonnow, 35 heb mar an voyla a leverel a-dalleth: 36 "O eneval a'th esa kudynnow,
37 Romagneth dha dir na'th esa, ha na'th esa byth, 38 heb bresel yn kellow an hy tyrannow; 39 mes nyns esa neb an-mes yn kler byth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Ravenna sta come stata è molt’ anni: 41 l’aguglia da Polenta la si cova, 42 sì che Cervia ricuopre co’ suoi vanni.
query.result:
**English:**
40 Ravenna remains as it has been for many years: 41 the eagle of Polenta broods over it, 42 so that it covers Cervia with its wings.
**Cornish:**
40 Ravenna a wra ynwedh avel o lies bledhynnyow: 41 an erow a Polenta a'y kov, 42 yn aga Cervia gans y eselyow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 La terra che fé già la lunga prova 44 e di Franceschi sanguinoso mucchio, 45 sotto le branche verdi si ritrova.
query.result:
**English:**
43 The land that once endured the long trial 44 and bloody heap of Frenchmen, 45 is found again beneath the green branches.
**Cornish:**
43 An tir o wrug an prof hir 44 ha gwask gwaedlydh an Frynk, 45 a'n jeves dhyworth an geyn gwer.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 E ’l mastin vecchio e ’l nuovo da Verrucchio, 47 che fecer di Montagna il mal governo, 48 là dove soglion fan d’i denti succhio.
query.result:
**English:**
46 And the old and new mastiffs of Verrucchio, 47 who made Montagna suffer from their misrule, 48 there, where they are accustomed to it, gnash their teeth.
**Cornish:**
46 Ha'n mastiff koth ha nowyth a Verrucchio, 47 a wrug an gwella governans a Vontagna, 48 ena, le mayth usys, y fynnont aga dhens.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Le città di Lamone e di Santerno 50 conduce il lïoncel dal nido bianco, 51 che muta parte da la state al verno.
query.result:
**English:**
49 The cities of Lamone and Santerno 50 are led by the young lion with the white lair, 51 who changes sides from summer to winter.
**Cornish:**
49 An drevyth a Lamone ha Santerno 50 a'n arweudh an lew yowynk a'n wul gwyn, 51 a wra chanjya unn rann dhyworth an hav dhe'n gwav.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 E quella cu’ il Savio bagna il fianco, 53 così com’ ella sie’ tra ’l piano e ’l monte, 54 tra tirannia si vive e stato franco.
query.result:
**English:**
52 And that [city] which the Savio bathes on its flank, 53 just as it is situated between the plain and the mountain, 54 so it lives between tyranny and a free state.
**Cornish:**
52 Ha henna a wra'n Savio ow kolghi y kylgh, 53 kepar ha bos orth yntra'n plan ha'n menydh, 54 yntra tirannieth ha stat frank yma byw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Ora chi se’, ti priego che ne conte; 56 non esser duro più ch’altri sia stato, 57 se ’l nome tuo nel mondo tegna fronte».
query.result:
**English:**
55 Now who are you, I beg you to tell us; 56 do not be harder than others have been, 57 if your name holds its head high in the world."
**Cornish:**
55 Neb, pyw os, yth pyth, dell dhyn ni; 56 na vyth moy esomdur ages tus a veu, 57 mar teu hanow yn y'n bys a wra'n tal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Poscia che ’l foco alquanto ebbe rugghiato 59 al modo suo, l’aguta punta mosse 60 di qua, di là, e poi diè cotal fiato:
61 «S’i’ credesse che mia risposta fosse 62 a persona che mai tornasse al mondo, 63 questa fiamma staria sanza più scosse;
64 ma però che già mai di questo fondo 65 non tornò vivo alcun, s’i’ odo il vero, 66 sanza tema d’infamia ti rispondo.
query.result:
**English:**
58 After the fire had roared for a while 59 in its own way, it moved its sharp point 60 here and there, and then it spoke these words:
61 "If I believed that my answer would be given 62 to someone who would ever return to the world, 63 this flame would remain still and not flicker;
64 but since no one has ever returned alive from this depth, 65 if what I hear is true, 66 I will answer you without fear of infamy.
**Cornish:**
58 Wosa'n tan a wrug an tan ow rughesa 59 yn y fordh henna, y bennow sharp a wayas 60 ena, ena, ha wosa henna a leveris an gerow ma:
61 "Mar kredyssen vyth ow dasson a veu dhynnerghys 62 dhe berson a wra'n dyllo dhe'n bys, 63 an flamm ma a wra'n heb moy skossya;
64 mes rag ytho henna nyns eus neb bewnans a'n downder ma 65 nyns eus neb dyllo byw, mar klevyn vyth an gwir, 66 heb dowt a anghowder vyth dasson."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Io fui uom d’arme, e poi fui cordigliero, 68 credendomi, sì cinto, fare ammenda; 69 e certo il creder mio venìa intero,
70 se non fosse il gran prete, a cui mal prenda!, 71 che mi rimise ne le prime colpe; 72 e come e quare, voglio che m’intenda.
query.result:
**English:**
67 I was a man of arms, and then I was a Franciscan friar, 68 believing that, thus belted, I would make amends; 69 and certainly my belief would have been fulfilled,
70 if it had not been for the great priest, may evil befall him!, 71 who led me back to my former sins; 72 and how and why, I want you to understand.
**Cornish:**
67 Yth oen den a armys, ha wosa henna yth oen kordylyer, 68 ow kredis, kepar henna, yth wruthyl amendya; 69 ha sur, ow kredens o veu komplenys,
70 mar nad o veu an bra's meur, dell anghowder dh'y ben!, 71 a wra'n ow tos dhe'n kynsa kulpyow; 72 ha kepar ha'gas, yma fynna vyth ow komprehendya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Mentre ch’io forma fui d’ossa e di polpe 74 che la madre mi diè, l’opere mie 75 non furon leonine, ma di volpe.
query.result:
**English:**
73 While I was a form of bones and flesh 74 that my mother gave me, my deeds 75 were not like a lion's, but like a fox's.
**Cornish:**
73 Tra veur yth oen furv a esow ha kig 74 a ro'm mamm ow thynna vy, ow oberow 75 na veu leonyon, mes kepar lowarn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Li accorgimenti e le coperte vie 77 io seppi tutte, e sì menai lor arte, 78 ch’al fine de la terra il suono uscie.
query.result:
**English:**
76 The cleverness and the hidden ways 77 I knew them all, and I plied their art so well, 78 that the sound of it reached the ends of the earth.
**Cornish:**
76 An akordmansow ha'n fordhow koverys 77 yth owth usya oll, ha kepar henna yth owth usya aga art, 78 bys dhe'n diwedh a'n bys an son a veu klevys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Quando mi vidi giunto in quella parte 80 di mia etade ove ciascun dovrebbe 81 calar le vele e raccoglier le sarte,
82 ciò che pria mi piacëa, allor m’increbbe, 83 e pentuto e confesso mi rendei; 84 ahi miser lasso! e giovato sarebbe.
query.result:
**English:**
79 When I saw myself arrived at that part 80 of my age when everyone should 81 lower the sails and furl the ropes,
82 what had pleased me before, then displeased me, 83 and I repented and confessed and surrendered myself; 84 ah, wretched me! and it would have been of no avail.
**Cornish:**
79 Pan welyn vyth ow tos yn henna rann 80 a'm oos owth dhe bys le mayth pub den 81 leha'n seyl an welow ha'n gordhow ow tenna,
82 henna a veu owth owth karas vyth a-rag, 83 ha owth owth penedhys ha owth owth konfessys vyth ow tos; 84 ah, meskin mes! ha henna a veu heb us.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Lo principe d’i novi Farisei, 86 avendo guerra presso a Laterano, 87 e non con Saracin né con Giudei,
88 ché ciascun suo nimico era cristiano, 89 e nessun era stato a vincer Acri 90 né mercatante in terra di Soldano,
91 né sommo officio né ordini sacri 92 guardò in sé, né in me quel capestro 93 che solea fare i suoi cinti più macri.
query.result:
**English:**
85 The prince of the new Pharisees, 86 having war near the Lateran, 87 and not with Saracens or Jews,
88 for every enemy of his was a Christian, 89 and none had been to conquer Acre 90 or a merchant in the land of the Sultan,
91 nor did he consider in himself any high office or holy orders, 92 nor in me that cord 93 that used to make his belts thinner.
**Cornish:**
85 An prinj a'n Fariseyon nowydh, 86 ow kensa yn-mes a Lateran, 87 ha na gans Sarasinow na Yedhewon,
88 rag an oll en emlow o oas Kristyon, 89 ha nyns eus neb a veu dhe gwaynya Akri 90 po marghas yn tir an Soldan,
91 na offis ughella na urdh sakrow 92 a welas ynnos, na ynnos an keppester 93 a wra gwre aga gweres moy tenew.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Ma come Costantin chiese Silvestro 95 d’entro Siratti a guerir de la lebbre, 96 così mi chiese questi per maestro
97 a guerir de la sua superba febbre; 98 domandommi consiglio, e io tacetti 99 perché le sue parole parver ebbre.
query.result:
**English:**
94 But as Constantine asked Sylvester 95 to cure him of leprosy from within Siratti, 96 so this one asked me as a teacher
97 to cure him of his proud fever; 98 he asked me for advice, and I was silent 99 because his words seemed drunken.
**Cornish:**
94 Mes kepar ha Konstantin a vynnas Silvester 95 a-ji dhe Siratti dhe wovya an lepr, 96 hemma a vynnas vy dhe dhyskas
97 dhe wovya an y feur a sur, 98 ow kovsel a vynnas vy, ha vy a dhewis 99 rag y gerow a semlas medhow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 E’ poi ridisse: “Tuo cuor non sospetti; 101 finor t’assolvo, e tu m’insegna fare 102 sì come Penestrino in terra getti.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And then he said again: “Let not your heart be suspicious; 101 I absolve you beforehand, and you teach me how 102 to cast Palestrina to the ground.
**Cornish:**
100 Ha wosa hwath: “Na voes dha galon gorra; 101 bythkensa vyth assolvaf vy, ha’th ensyn vy gwre 102 kepar ha Penestrino a dhewis dhe’n nor.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Lo ciel poss’ io serrare e diserrare, 104 come tu sai; però son due le chiavi 105 che ’l mio antecessor non ebbe care”.
query.result:
**English:**
103 I can lock and unlock heaven, 104 as you know; therefore there are two keys 105 that my predecessor did not care for.
**Cornish:**
103 An nef a allaf vy serri ha digori, 104 kepar hag a wodhow; rag hemma yw an dhew gev 105 na vynnas aga ragori vyth ragori.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Allor mi pinser li argomenti gravi 107 là ’ve ’l tacer mi fu avviso ’l peggio, 108 e dissi: “Padre, da che tu mi lavi
109 di quel peccato ov’ io mo cader deggio, 110 lunga promessa con l’attender corto 111 ti farà trïunfar ne l’alto seggio”.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Then I pondered the weighty arguments 107 where I thought silence was the worst, 108 and I said: “Father, since you cleanse me
109 of that sin into which I must fall, 110 a long promise with a short fulfillment 111 will make you triumph in the high seat”.
**Cornish:**
106 Anedhen vy a studhyas an argumentiow poesek, 107 le may hwath an tewa oas an gwella, 108 ha vy a leveris: “Tas, a-banna vy vyth golhi
109 a’n pechodra may hwra vyth kodha, 110 promess hir gans attendya berr 111 a wra trigva trehedhes yn an sedh ughella.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Francesco venne poi, com’ io fu’ morto, 113 per me; ma un d’i neri cherubini 114 li disse: “Non portar: non mi far torto.
query.result:
**English:**
112 Francis came later, as I was dead, 113 for me; but one of the black cherubim 114 said to him: “Do not carry him: do not wrong me.
**Cornish:**
112 Fransis a dheuth wosa, kepar ha vy oas marow, 113 rag vy; mes unn a’n kerubinow du 114 a leveris dhodho: “Na dhort vy: na wra tort vyth vy.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Oh me dolente! come mi riscossi 122 quando mi prese dicendomi: “Forse 123 tu non pensavi ch’io löico fossi!”.
query.result:
**English:**
121 Oh me, how I shuddered 122 when he seized me, saying to me: “Perhaps 123 you did not think that I was a logician!”.
**Cornish:**
121 Oh vy dolians! kepar ha vy a skoodhas 122 pan a gemeras vy dhe leverel vy: “Marsek 123 na vynnas vy owth owth lojek!”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 A Minòs mi portò; e quelli attorse 125 otto volte la coda al dosso duro; 126 e poi che per gran rabbia la si morse,
127 disse: “Questi è d’i rei del foco furo”; 128 per ch’io là dove vedi son perduto, 129 e sì vestito, andando, mi rancuro».
query.result:
**English:**
124 He brought me to Minos; and he twisted 125 his tail eight times around his hard back; 126 and then, in great rage, he bit it,
127 saying: “This one is of the kings of the fiery furnace”; 128 therefore I am lost where you see me, 129 and thus dressed, I go about, complaining».
**Cornish:**
124 Ev a dhort vy dhe Minos; ha henna a wrigas 125 eth woth gweyth y lost dhe’y geyn kalet; 126 ha wosa henna a’y byskas ynno gans rabia bras,
127 ev a leveris: “Henna yw unn a’n reow a’n tan a fur”; 128 rag hemma le may whel vyth kollet, 129 ha hemma wiskes, ow mos, vyth kwendal.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Quand’ elli ebbe ’l suo dir così compiuto, 131 la fiamma dolorando si partio, 132 torcendo e dibattendo ’l corno aguto.
query.result:
**English:**
130 When he had thus completed his speech, 131 the flame departed, grieving, 132 twisting and lashing its sharp horn.
**Cornish:**
130 Pan oas ev y lavarow owth kompletya, 131 an flam a dheuth omma, ow dolurya, 132 ow torni ha ow skeli y horn krev.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Noi passamm’ oltre, e io e ’l duca mio, 134 su per lo scoglio infino in su l’altr’ arco 135 che cuopre ’l fosso in che si paga il fio
136 a quei che scommettendo acquistan carco.
query.result:
**English:**
133 We passed on, my guide and I, 134 up over the cliff to the next arch 135 that covers the ditch where those pay the price
136 who, by gambling, acquire a burden.
**Cornish:**
133 Ni a drehedhons, ow ha’gas ow duga, 134 wartha’n karrek bys dhe’n arall bow, 135 a wra kovr an foss le mayth an prys
136 dhe’n re betha, gans gambola, a gav karga.
